item.title: Form problem
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’m not sure what you mean. Do you want to enter a string, output what it contains then wait for the length you entered? If so:

var
s : string;
begin
s := ‘15’;
Writeln(‘We will wait for ’ + s + ’ seconds’);
Wait(IntToStr(s * 1000)); //Make miliseconds into seconds by timing it by 1000
end.

Read full topic

item.title: Form problem
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Oh, thanks! Btw, one more question, if lets say I want it to type in
something like text, variable then text again like

‘This script will run for’ + waittime + ‘seconds’

how would I go about writing that line of code? Would I need commas or anything? Could you please give me an example? Really appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: Form problem
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Shadower:

Thanks,works, by the way, could you please explain to my why I cannot use ''s? Is it because they are meant only for text to be typed in?

If you use ''s, the script doesn’t know your using a variable and reads it as it is. For example,

var
s : string;
begin
s := ‘hello’;
Writeln(s); //This prints out what the variable s contains
Writeln(‘s’); //This prints out “s”
end.

Read full topic

item.title: Form problem
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Because you want to use the WaitTime variable correct?
‘’ Identifies a string, But you are using WaitTime so what you had tried to turn “waittime” into an integer, Instead of the value of WaitTime variable.
To use a variable simply put the name of it

item.title: Form problem
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Decided to add a very basic form to NUDGE~.

[code]program ClickOnTheNudgeButton;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

var
NudgeButton, x, y, MyMark : Integer;
Seconds : TForm;
Label1 : TLabel;
Edit1 : TEdit;
OK : TButton;
Waittime : String;

procedure ButtonClick(sender: TObject);
begin
WriteLn(‘You have clicked the button’);
seconds.Caption:= seconds.Caption + ‘.’;
seconds.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

Procedure Initform;
begin
Seconds := CreateForm;
Seconds.Left := 224;
Seconds.Top := 252;
Seconds.Width := 603;
Seconds.Height := 264;
Seconds.Caption := ‘Seconds’;
Seconds.Color := clBtnFace;
Seconds.Font.Color := clWindowText;
Seconds.Font.Height := -11;
Seconds.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
Seconds.Font.Style := [];
Seconds.Visible := False;
Seconds.PixelsPerInch := 96;
Label1 := TLabel.Create(Seconds);
Label1.Parent := Seconds;
Label1.Left := 16;
Label1.Top := 24;
Label1.Width := 224;
Label1.Height := 24;
Label1.Caption := ‘Number of seconds to run:’;
Label1.Font.Color := clWindowText;
Label1.Font.Height := -20;
Label1.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
Label1.Font.Style := [];
Label1.ParentFont := False;
Edit1 := TEdit.Create(Seconds);
Edit1.Parent := Seconds;
Edit1.Left := 264;
Edit1.Top := 24;
Edit1.Width := 321;
Edit1.Height := 24;
Edit1.Font.Color := clWindowText;
Edit1.Font.Height := -15;
Edit1.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
Edit1.Font.Style := [];
Edit1.ParentFont := False;
Edit1.TabOrder := 8;
Edit1.Text := ‘Edit1’;
OK := TButton.Create(Seconds);
OK.Parent := Seconds;
OK.OnClick := @ButtonClick;
OK.Left := 32;
OK.Top := 72;
OK.Width := 297;
OK.Height := 73;
OK.Caption := ‘OK’;
OK.Font.Color := clWindowText;
OK.Font.Height := -20;
OK.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
OK.Font.Style := [];
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
seconds.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

procedure SetupAll;
begin
waittime := Edit1.Text;
end;

Procedure MyMarking;
begin
MarkTime(MyMark);
SendKeys(‘Created By InsertNameHere,Nudging you to death.’+ chr(13));
Wait(1000+ Random(1000));
end;

function Timer: boolean;
begin
if TimeFromMark(MyMark) > (1* (Strtoint(‘waittime’)) * 1000) then //We set MyMark before hand right?
begin
Result := True; //this IS a boolean
end;
end;

Function Failsafe: Boolean;
begin
if(IsKeyDown(chr(49)))then //the ‘1’ button
begin
result := True;
end;
end;

Procedure Clickonnudge;
begin
NudgeButton:=DTMFromString(‘78DA637462646078CD80027EBCF000D38C503’ +
‘EA32390F51955CDFB1FFF51D5F803596F51D5BCFD8EA60664D723’ +
‘5435BFFFA2A93103B25EA2AAF9F20B4D8D2590F511CD2E74F7F80’ +
‘2594F50D5FCFC83A6C68A08356E44F8DD0FC87A85AA46CFBF1F33’ +
‘7C9EA1AAF9FE1BCD1C774CF73CB97701558D0DA69AD8B2E5286A0’ +
‘0DC343102’);
if(findDTM(NudgeButton, x, y, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2))then
begin
repeat
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, true);
until(timer) or (Failsafe);
end;
end;

begin
SetupSRL
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
Setupall;
FreeForm(Seconds);
ActivateClient;
MyMarking;
ClickonNudge;
end.[/code]

They give me

[Runtime Error] : Exception: 'waittime' is not a valid integer value in line 108 in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 3.12\Scripts\Own Scripts\NUDGE!!.scar

Weird thing is, I already declared that waittime was a string and I already put

(strtoint('waittime'))

and I filled in waittime as 50 seconds, a vaild integer value. Even if there was something wrong with the

procedure SetupAll; begin waittime := Edit1.Text; end;
part, as in wrong name or something, it would still be an integer, albeit 0.(Isn’t 0 an integer?) So why does it return a non valid integer value error? Help please!

Read full topic
